thread.title: Sydney weather: Severe thunderstorm causes havoc on roads, public transport
thread.title_full: Sydney weather: Severe thunderstorm causes havoc on roads, public transport

title: Sydney weather: Severe thunderstorm causes havoc on roads, public transport
text:
Don't Play Swap the sunscreen for brollies 
Wet and cloudy weather on Tuesday and Wednesday will give Sydney a short break from the heat before the temperatures quickly rise again at the weekend. Live updates 11:13am Severe thunderstorm warning issued 
A severe thunderstorm warning has been issued for heavy rainfall and damaging winds across the Sydney metropolitan, Hunter, Illawarra and Central Tablelands forecast districts on Tuesday morning, as wild weather caused havoc on the city's roads and public transport. 
Just before the warning was issued, severe thunderstorms were detected on the weather radar near Sydney Airport and Marrickville, the bureau said. Those storms were forecast to affect Botany, Maroubra and Randwick by 10.55am. 
The weather warning said severe thunderstorms are likely to produce heavy rainfall that may lead to flash flooding and damaging winds in the warning area over the next several hours. 
Locations which may be affected include Gosford, Sydney, Penrith, Parramatta, Campbelltown and Katoomba. 
The area affected by the severe thunderstorm warning. Photo: Bureau of Meteorology
